definition: prefix used before the surname of a person or a numeral indicating the order of birth of the children in a family or to indicate affection or familiarity/old (of people)/venerable (person)/experienced/of long standing/always/all the time/of the past/very/outdated/(of meat etc) tough

son/child/seed/egg/small thing/1st earthly branch: 11 p.m.-1 a.m., midnight, 11th solar month (7th December to 5th January), year of the Rat/Viscount, fourth of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/ancient Chinese compass point: 0° (north)

sentences.english: Lucy: If you're ever in an argument, you can always trump with a dead mother.
sentences.chinese: 如果相持不下就使出你死老妈子的绝招。

sentences.english: I'm too smart to believe in that kind of old wives' tale.
sentences.chinese: 我才不会傻到相信那种老妈子的鬼话。

sentences.english: Does not need to guess that, understood at a glance is result which the female servant creates.
sentences.chinese: 不用猜，一看就知道是老妈子造成的结果。

sentences.english: You look like my old maidservant at this time.
sentences.chinese: 你这个时候看起来真像个老妈子。

sentences.english: My grandmothers didn't do anything but keep house and serve everybody.
sentences.chinese: 我的祖母辈们都没事可干，除了顾家和当老妈子。

sentences.english: Jim: You look like my old maidservant at this time.
sentences.chinese: 你这个时候看起来真像个老妈子。

definition: young married woman/mistress/(fig.) punching bag/(old) child bride
young lady of the house/wife of the young master
girl/servant girl/(used deprecatingly, but sometimes also as a term of endearment)
daughter-in-law/wife (of a younger man)/young married woman/young woman
